cause.description:
The National Breast Cancer Foundation was founded by breast cancer survivor Janelle Hail, who was diagnosed with breast cancer in 1980 at the age of 34. As a result of early detection, she survived the disease and has devoted her life to educate women about early detection and provide free mammograms for women who could not afford them.
For more information, please visit www.nbcf.org.
1. As part of our mission, we work with hospitals in 48 states across the U.S. to provide free mamograms for women in need.
2. We are dedicated to saving lives by increasing awareness of breast cancer through education.
cause.mission: The National Breast Cancer Foundation's mission is to save lives by increasing awareness of breast cancer through education and by providing mammograms for those in need.
cause.name: National Breast Cancer Foundation Awareness
